clauses.title: Transition from Contractor to Employee
clauses.body: This Addendum documents the transition of {{person_name}} (the 'Individual') from independent contractor to employee of {{company_name}} (the 'Company'). The existing contractor agreement will terminate on {{contractor_end_date}}, and employment will begin on {{transition_date}}.

clauses.title: Termination of Contractor Relationship
clauses.body: All rights and obligations under the previous contractor agreement will end on {{contractor_end_date}}. The Individual will submit a final invoice for any outstanding contractor work by that date. Any ongoing projects will be transitioned to the new employment arrangement.

clauses.title: New Employment Terms
clauses.body: Beginning {{transition_date}}, the Individual will be employed as {{new_job_title}} with an annual salary of {{new_salary}}. The Individual will receive a separate employment contract detailing full terms, conditions, and benefits. Employment will be at-will and subject to standard company policies.

clauses.title: Intellectual Property Transition
clauses.body: All intellectual property created as a contractor (as defined in the contractor agreement) remains subject to those terms. All work product created from {{transition_date}} forward will be owned by the Company under the employment agreement. Any transitional projects will be clearly documented regarding ownership.

clauses.title: Benefits & Tax Status
clauses.body: As an employee, the Individual will be eligible for company benefits including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off as outlined in the Employee Handbook. The Company will withhold taxes and provide W-2 tax forms. The Individual is no longer responsible for self-employment taxes or business expenses.

clauses.title: New Obligations
clauses.body: The Individual will be subject to all employee obligations including confidentiality agreements, IP assignment, and any non-compete or non-solicitation provisions (subject to state law). The Individual will receive and acknowledge these documents as part of the employment onboarding process.

clauses.title: Continuity & Knowledge Transfer
clauses.body: The Company values the Individual's existing knowledge and relationships developed during the contractor period. The Individual agrees to facilitate a smooth transition, including transferring knowledge, introducing clients (where appropriate), and ensuring project continuity.

clauses.title: Outstanding Contractor Matters
clauses.body: Any outstanding payments, expenses, or obligations from the contractor relationship will be settled by {{contractor_end_date}}. Neither party will have further obligations under the contractor agreement after all outstanding matters are resolved.

clauses.title: Governing Law
clauses.body: This Addendum is governed by New York law. It supplements and modifies the existing contractor agreement and will be incorporated into the new employment agreement.

clauses.title: Signatures
clauses.body:
By signing below, both parties agree to this transition from contractor to employee status.

Individual: _________________ Date: _______

Company Representative: _________________ Date: _______

annotations.tooltip: Clearly terminate the contractor relationship to avoid dual classification issues.
Clarify which IP rules apply to transitional work to avoid disputes.
Document the change in tax status and benefit eligibility clearly.
